title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A 
- Temporary Restrictions) (Covid-19) (No. 2) (Amendment) (No. 9) 
Regulations 2021. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on the 26th day of July

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 2. The Health Act 1947 (Section 31A - Temporary Restrictions) (Covid-
text_raw:
2. The Health Act 1947 (Section 31A - Temporary Restrictions) (Covid-

19) (No.2) Regulations 2021 (S.I. No. 217 of 2021) are amended - 

(a) 

in Regulation 12, by the substitution of the following paragraph 
for paragraph (1): 

“(1) Except to the extent to which it is lawful for an indoor 
operator to permit or otherwise grant access to a premises in 
accordance with section 31AB of the Act of 1947, or in 
accordance with any regulations made under that section, a 
specified person shall ensure that members of the public are not 
permitted, or otherwise granted, access to a premises in a 
relevant geographical location where a business or service 
specified in Schedule 2 is carried on or otherwise provided.”, 
and 

(b) 

in Regulation 13 - 

(i) 

in paragraph (1)(b), by the substitution of “Without 
prejudice to the generality of Regulation 12, and except to

“Iris Oifigiúil” of 27th July, 2021.

the extent to which it is lawful for an indoor operator to 
permit or otherwise grant access to a premises in 
accordance with section 31AB of the Act of 1947, or in 
accordance with any regulations made under that section,” 
for “Without prejudice to the generality of Regulation 
12,”, 

(ii) by the substitution of the following paragraphs for 

paragraph (2): 

“(2) A specified person shall, in relation to a relevant 

premises or a relevant accommodation premises - 

(a) 

(b) 

the purpose of 

in the case of a party of persons being 
permitted, or otherwise granted, access to 
the premises for 
the 
consumption of food or beverages, make a 
record of the time at, and date on, which the 
first member of the party (in this Regulation 
referred 
to as a “lead person”) was 
permitted, or otherwise granted, access to 
the premises, and that person’s name and 
telephone number, and 

in the case of a person permitted, or 
otherwise granted, access to the premises 
for the purpose of the consumption of food 
or beverages who is not a member of a 
party of persons (in this Regulation referred 
to as a “sole person”), make a record of the 
time at, and date on, which the person was 
permitted, or otherwise granted, access to 
the premises, and that person’s name and 
telephone number. 

(2A) Names and telephone numbers recorded by a 
specified person for the purposes of paragraph (2) shall 
not be made available to a compliance officer (within the 
meaning of section 2 of the Act of 1947).”, and 

(iii) by the substitution of the following paragraph for 

paragraph (4): 

“(4) (a) For the purposes of paragraph (2)(a), a 
specified person may request a lead person 
to provide the specified person with the 
lead person’s name and telephone number 
and, where that specified person does so, 
the lead person shall comply with that 
request. 

(b) For the purposes of paragraph (2)(b), a 
specified person may request a sole person 
to provide the specified person with the sole 
person’s name and telephone number and,

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A - Temporary 
Restrictions) (Covid-19) (No. 2) Regulations 2021 (S.I. No. 217 of 2021) to 
provide for, among others, certain technical amendments.
